abstract: Inflation slows in China as stringent controls on bank lending and a gradually strengthening currency begin to tame strongly rising prices, including 13.4 percent increase in food prices.
snippet: Inflation slowed slightly for consumers last month in China as stringent controls on bank lending and a gradually strengthening currency began to tame strongly rising prices.
lead_paragraph: Inflation slowed slightly for consumers last month in China as stringent controls on bank lending and a gradually strengthening currency began to tame strongly rising prices.

headline.main: Inflation in China Eases, but Food Prices Up Sharply
headline.print_headline: Inflation in China Eases, but Food Prices Up Sharply
